intro: Pleurophora pungens, commonly known as the sharp-lobed hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are pinnately lobed, and the plant produces long, slender seed pods that release tiny seeds when mature. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
